meanings.definition: To dress up or adorn in a showy or flashy manner.
meanings.sent1: She gussied herself up for the party with sparkly earrings and a bright dress.
meanings.sent2: The performer gussied up in a colorful costume before going on stage.
meanings.sent3: He gussied up his pet dog in a tiny top hat and bowtie for fun.
meanings.sent4: The garden was gussied up with fairy lights, making it look magical.
meanings.sent5: The old car was gussied up with a fresh coat of paint, making it shine like new.

meanings.definition: To make fancy or elaborate in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The chef gussied up the dessert with edible gold leaf for a special touch.
meanings.sent2: She gussied up her room with colorful pillows and a fluffy rug.
meanings.sent3: The cat gussied up its usual meow with a little trill at the end.
meanings.sent4: The story was gussied up with exaggerated details to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent5: The plain cupcakes were gussied up with swirls of frosting and sprinkles, becoming irresistible.
